document.docAuthor: Chullasorn, Supawadee, Kangtia, Pawana, Song, Sung Joon & Khim, Jong Seong
document.docTitle: Tigriopus namsaiensis Chullasorn & Kangtia & Song & Khim 2021, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Two new species of Tigriopus Norman, 1869 from Chonburi Province, Thailand (Crustacea: Copepoda: Harpacticidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Two new species of Tigriopus Norman, 1869 from Chonburi Province, Thailand (Crustacea: Copepoda: Harpacticidae)

mods:name.mods:affiliation: Department of Biology, Bansomdejchaopraya Rajabhat University, Bangkok 10600, Thailand.

School of Earth and Environmental Sciences & Research Institute of Oceanography, Seoul National University, Seoul 08826, Korea. sungjoons @ gmail. com; https: // orcid. org / 0000 - 0001 - 6177 - 2723

School of Earth and Environmental Sciences & Research Institute of Oceanography, Seoul National University, Seoul 08826, Korea. sungjoons @ gmail. com; https: // orcid. org / 0000 - 0001 - 6177 - 2723 & jskocean @ snu. ac. kr; https: // orcid. org / 0000 - 0001 - 7977 - 0929

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Type locality.
Associated with green algae,
Ulva clathrata
attached to a small rock at the sandy
Namsai Beach in Sattahip
district, Chonburi Province , Thailand ( 12°36’12.7”N , 100°56’38.5”E ) on 6 August , 2017: collected by S. Chullasorn.

Adult female holotype (NIBRIV0000851927) dissected on six slides; male allotype (NIBRIV0000851928) dissected on three slides: three female and three male paratypes (NIBRIV0000851929) preserved in 95% alcohol.

subSubSection.paragraph: Etymology. The species name refers to the type locality at Namsai Beach.

Description of female. Total body length of holotype 959 µm ( Fig. 1A–B ), measured from tip of rostrum to posterior margin of caudal ramus. Total body length of paratypes 900–1,030 µm ( n = 12, mean = 960 µm). Body compact, cyclopiform ornamented with few sensilla on surface. Nauplius eye not visible. Prosome 4-segmented, comprising cephalosome fused to first pedigerous somite, and three free pedigerous somites. Cephalothorax longer than three prosomites combined, posterior margin smooth. Rostrum ( Fig. 3A ) large, slightly longer than first segment of antennule, with two pairs of sensilla; the first pair close to the rounded tip, and the second pair at halfway the rostrum length.

FIGURE 1.
Tigriopus namsaiensis
sp. nov .
(♀): (A) holotype, habitus, dorsal; (B) holotype, habitus, lateral; (C) caudal ramus seta V.

Tigriopus namsaiensis
sp. nov .

FIGURE 3.
Tigriopus namsaiensis
sp. nov .

FIGURE 4.
Tigriopus namsaiensis
sp. nov .
(♀): (A) mandible, anterior; (B) maxillule, anterior; (C) maxilla, anterior; (D) maxilliped, anterior.

subSubSection.paragraph: Armature formula of swimming legs as follows (Arabic numbers represent setae, Roman numbers represent spines):

FIGURE 5.
Tigriopus namsaiensis
sp. nov .
(♀): (A) P1, anterior; (B) P2, anterior.

FIGURE 6.
Tigriopus namsaiensis
sp. nov .
(♀): (A) P3, anterior; (B) P4, anterior.

FIGURE 7.
Tigriopus namsaiensis
sp. nov .
(♂): (A) allotype, habitus, dorsal; (B) allotype, habitus, lateral; (C) caudal ramus seta V; (D) antenna, anterior.

FIGURE 8.
Tigriopus namsaiensis
sp. nov .
(♂: A–B, D) (♀: C): (A) rostrum, dorsal; (B) left antennule, anterior; (C) P5, anterior; (D) P5, anterior.

FIGURE 9.
Tigriopus namsaiensis
sp. nov .
(♂): (A) urosome, with P6 on both lateral sides; (B) P2, anterior.

subSubSection.paragraph: Description of male. Total body length of allotype ( Fig. 7A–B ) 902 µm. Total body length of paratypes 796– 929 µm ( n = 12, mean = 874 µm). Rostrum ( Fig. 8A ), general body shape and size similar to those of female. Sexual dimorphism expressed in antennule, antenna, P2, P5, P6, and urosomal segmentation.
P3 and P4 as in female.
